lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/codsworth.codsworth.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run codsworth.codsworth.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
**TODO Things (Easy marks for PR reviewers lol)**
1. Level 7: Save user tasks without having to type 'bye'
2. Level 8: Add more stretch goals like sorting tasks by dates or a command to print deadlines/events occurring on a specific date
3. Add more JUnit tests and fix the exceptions
4. Change to only 1 exception instead of multiple, fix UI texts, create an easy UI text displayer

Need a handy companion to assist you after the end of all human life?
Codsworth is a desktop app for managing tasks,
optimized for use via a Command Line Interface (CLI) while still having
the benefits of a Graphical User Interface (GUI).
If you can type fast, Codsworth can get your tasks done faster than traditional GUI apps.
Add to do task that doesn't have any deadline or time requirements.
Codsworth will return a task of that name
Got it, I've added this task:
Add a deadline task which has a deadline requirement.
> Timing is optional, you don't have to provide HHMM
Codsworth will return a deadline of that name
Got it, I've added this task:
Add an event task which has start and end time requirement.
> Timing is optional, you don't have to provide HHMM
Codsworth will return an event of that name
Got it, I've added this task:
Shows a list of all tasks.
Here are all the task(s) in your list:
Marks a specified task as completed
Nice, I've marked this task as completed!
Unmarks a specified task as uncompleted
I've unmarked this task as completed!
Finds task whose name contain the given keyword
Clears all saved tasks and storage
